snippet: A Croatian expatriate worker believed to have been beheaded by the Islamic State’s Egyptian affiliate was initially abducted by a different group that demanded a ransom.
abstract: Croatia says Croatian expatriate worker Tomislav Salopek, thought to have been beheaded in Egypt by Islamic State's Egyptian affiliate Sinai Province, was initially abducted near Cairo by different group that demanded ransom.
lead_paragraph: A Croatian expatriate worker believed to have been beheaded by the Islamic State’s Egyptian affiliate was initially abducted by a different group that demanded a ransom.

headline.main: Egypt: 2 Groups Handled Hostage, Croatia Says
headline.print_headline: Middle East; Egypt: 2 Groups Handled Hostage, Croatia Says
